com.brightcove.player.mediacontroller

Interface BrightcoveSeekBar

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BrightcoveSeekBarImpl

    public interface BrightcoveSeekBar
    Defines the operations that must be supported on a custom media controller. In general, all customization is accomplished via Android XML attributes using the standard (android) and Brightcove (bmc) namespaces. Using and Customizing: There are three areas of the Brightcove seek bar that can be customized: progress bar, scrubber and ad markers. The progress bar supports three new attributes, bmc:progress-color, bmc:buffering-color and bmc:remaining-color where the value is a standard Android color value. The scrubber (circle acting as a thumb handle for controlling seeking) can be disabled using the new Brightcove attribute bmc:scrubber-visibility=gone with values of visible, invisible, and gone. The scrubber color can be set using the new attribute bmc:scrubber-color. Ad markers can be configured with the attributes bmc:ad-marker-color and bmc:ad-marker-width (where the value is an integer number of pixels). Ad markers can be set using the SDK eventing system using the event type SET_AD_MARKERS with the event property AD_MARKER_LIST specifying a list of integer playhead positions. To clear all ad markers, provide an empty list in the event property AD_MARKER_LIST. At runtime, the standard Android seek bar can be obtained using the getSeekBar() method. And finally, at runtime, the application developer can determine if the scrubber is being dragged using the isDragging() method.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String AD_MARKER_LIST
      The event property key specifying the playhead positions at which an ad marker should be placed.
      static java.lang.String SET_AD_MARKERS
      Standard event type for supplying ad markers to the seek bar.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.widget.SeekBar getSeekBar()
      Obtains the Android seek bar widget wrapped inside of a Brightcove seek bar.
      boolean isDragging()
      Indicates if the seek bar is currently being dragged by a User.
      void setEventEmitter(EventEmitter eventEmitter)
      Provides an event emitter on which to set up SDK event handlers.

    • Field Detail

      • SET_AD_MARKERS

        static final java.lang.String SET_AD_MARKERS
        Standard event type for supplying ad markers to the seek bar.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AD_MARKER_LIST

        static final java.lang.String AD_MARKER_LIST
        The event property key specifying the playhead positions at which an ad marker should be placed. The value must be of type: List. A missing or empty list will result in all ad markers being removed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getSeekBar

        android.widget.SeekBar getSeekBar()
        Obtains the Android seek bar widget wrapped inside of a Brightcove seek bar.
        Returns:
        The non-null seek bar widget.

      • isDragging

        boolean isDragging()
        Indicates if the seek bar is currently being dragged by a User.
        Returns:
        TRUE iff the User is currently dragging the seek bar scrubber.

      • setEventEmitter

        void setEventEmitter(EventEmitter eventEmitter)
        Provides an event emitter on which to set up SDK event handlers.
        Parameters:
        eventEmitter - The given SDK event emitter object.
